description: U.S. Federal Taxation of Individuals & Businesses. Learners will develop knowledge in U.S. federal taxation as applied to individuals and businesses.
learning_outcomes: Learners will gain expertise in U.S. federal taxation for individuals and businesses. They will learn to apply tax laws and develop knowledge of federal tax returns.
prerequisites: Basic understanding of accounting principles and financial concepts is recommended, but not strictly required.
price: Varies; Coursera offers subscription-based access, but individual course prices within the specialization may differ. Please check the Coursera website for details.
title: U.S. Federal Taxation Specialization

description: The Healthcare Law Specialization provides a comprehensive understanding of U.S. healthcare law and policy. It covers topics such as the Affordable Care Act, health insurance, privacy regulations (HIPAA), and healthcare management. Learn from leading experts in the field.
learning_outcomes: Upon completion, learners will understand key healthcare laws, including the Affordable Care Act and HIPAA. They will also gain insights into health policy, privacy issues, and healthcare management.
prerequisites: A basic understanding of legal concepts and an interest in healthcare are recommended. No prior legal experience is required.
price: Free to Audit. Paid Certificate Available.
skills: Health Insurance Portability And Accountability Act (HIPAA)
title: Healthcare Law Specialization

description: Learn how the Law Regulates the Cloud. Master the main legal and regulatory implications of using and providing cloud computing services.
learning_outcomes: Upon completion, you will understand the legal and regulatory aspects of cloud computing. You will master the implications of cloud services, data protection, cybersecurity, and international data transfers.
prerequisites: Basic understanding of legal concepts is recommended. No prior cloud computing knowledge is required.
price: Specialization courses on Coursera typically require a subscription, so the price is subscription-based.
title: Cloud Computing Law Specialization

description: Build skills to improve health & save lives. Learn foundational building blocks of humanitarian program planning, implementation, and evaluation.
learning_outcomes: Upon completion, learners will acquire skills in humanitarian program planning, implementation, and evaluation. They will also gain knowledge to improve health and save lives within a global context.
prerequisites: None. Basic understanding of public health concepts is helpful but not required.
price: Free to Audit. Paid option available for full access and certificate.
title: Foundations of Global Health Specialization

description: Launch your career in Europe. Master the essentials in European Business Law.
learning_outcomes: This specialization helps you master the fundamentals of European Business Law. You will learn about the legal framework and gain the skills to navigate the European market and potentially launch your career in Europe.
prerequisites: A basic understanding of business concepts is recommended. No prior legal knowledge is required.
price: Free to Audit. Paid access to assignments and certificate.
title: European Business Law  Specialization

description: This course begins by exploring short term entry and long term entry into the United States. We will cover the various means of short term entry and long term entry, as well as the general application processes. We will also examine exclusion and deportation in the United States. In particular, we will discuss how and why individuals may not be admitted into the United States and possible reasons for deportation or removal. Lastly, we will cover the process of how to become a United States citizen and the various requirements for naturalization.
learning_outcomes: Understand short and long term entry processes, grounds for exclusion and deportation, and the path to US citizenship through naturalization. Learn about application processes and legal requirements.
prerequisites: None. Basic understanding of legal concepts helpful but not required.
price: Free
title: Nuts and Bolts of U.S. Immigration Law

description: Launch your Career as a GST taxation executive. Build job-ready skills for an in-demand career as a GST professional in India. No prior experience required.
learning_outcomes: Gain job-ready skills in GST taxation, including e-invoicing, GST compliance, and return filing. Learn GST law, registration, and reconciliation to become a proficient GST professional in India.
prerequisites: No prior experience required. Basic understanding of accounting principles is helpful but not mandatory.
price: Pricing varies, check Coursera for current subscription or individual course pricing.
title: PwC GST Taxation Executive  Professional Certificate

description: American Contract Law I (along with its sister course Contracts II) provides a comprehensive overview of contract law in the United States. The course covers most of the key concepts found in a first year law school class. Each lecture is based on one or more common-law cases, integrating legal doctrines with policy discussions. The course also covers key sections from the Uniform Commercial Code (UCC), which governs the sale of goods.
learning_outcomes: Understand key concepts of American contract law. Learn to analyze common-law cases and the Uniform Commercial Code (UCC). Develop a foundational understanding suitable for further legal studies.
prerequisites: Basic understanding of legal concepts is recommended but not mandatory.
price: Free
title: American Contract Law I

description: About this Course
learning_outcomes: Understand the intersection of AI and law. Explore AI applications in legal practice and the ethical considerations. Learn about the impact of AI on legal systems and the future of the legal profession.
prerequisites: No prior experience required. A basic understanding of legal concepts is helpful but not essential.
price: Free to audit, paid certificate available
title: AI & Law

description: ‘The Arbitration of International Disputes’ is the third course of Leiden University’s  series on International Law in Action. The first course covered generalities on the international courts and tribunals in The Hague, while the second course provided an insider's  perspective into the work of international criminal courts and tribunals.  This third course explores the major aspects of international arbitration as one of the most common method of international dispute settlement . Through this course you will gain an in-depth understanding of the  various facets of international arbitration through the analysis of its role as a mechanism of dispute settlement, its institutions, the fields of law it is applicable to, and, of course, its most famous awards.
learning_outcomes: Upon completion, you will understand international arbitration's role, institutions, applicable legal fields, and significant awards, gaining an in-depth understanding of dispute resolution.
prerequisites: Basic understanding of international law is recommended.
price: Free
title: International Law in Action: the Arbitration of International Disputes

description: This course will give you a glimpse into six different areas of American law: Tort Law, Contract Law, Property, Constitutional Law, Criminal Law, and Civil Procedure. You will gain insight into the complexities and dilemmas that arise from the application of law in different settings, and what is distinctive about American approaches.
learning_outcomes: Upon completion, you will understand six key areas of American Law: Tort, Contract, Property, Constitutional, Criminal, and Civil Procedure. You will gain insight into the unique complexities of American legal approaches.
prerequisites: None. Basic understanding of English is recommended.
price: Free to Audit
title: An Introduction to American Law

description: Whether you are an advanced law student looking to review the basics, or an aspiring law student looking for head start, this course will help you build the foundation you will need to succeed in law school and beyond. This course will introduce you to terminology, concepts, and tools lawyers and legal academics use to make their arguments. It will help you follow these arguments—and make arguments of your own.
learning_outcomes: Understand legal terminology, concepts, and argumentation tools. Follow and construct legal arguments effectively. Build a strong foundation for success in law school and future legal careers.
prerequisites: None. Open to aspiring and current law students.
price: Free to Audit
title: A Law Student's Toolkit

description: “International Humanitarian Law in Theory and Practice” is the first MOOC of the Kalshoven-Gieskes Forum on International Humanitarian Law, which is the platform within the Grotius Centre for International Legal Studies of Leiden University for the research, teaching and dissemination of international humanitarian law (IHL).
learning_outcomes: Understand the core principles and rules of International Humanitarian Law (IHL). Learn about the application of IHL in various armed conflicts and situations. Analyze the challenges and developments in IHL.
prerequisites: None. Basic understanding of international relations or law is helpful, but not required.
price: Free (Audit Option), Paid (Certificate Option)
title: International Humanitarian Law in Theory and Practice

description: Environmental law may be the one institution standing between us and planetary exhaustion. It is also an institution that needs to be reconciled with human liberty and economic aspirations. This course considers these issues and provides a tour though existing legal regimes governing pollution, water law, endangered species, toxic substances, environmental impact analyses, and environmental risk.
learning_outcomes: Upon completion, students will understand key environmental law regimes, including those related to pollution, water, endangered species, and environmental risk, and their relation to human liberty and economic aspirations.
prerequisites: None. A basic understanding of social sciences and a general interest in environmental issues is helpful.
price: Free to audit.  Paid certificate available.
title: Introduction to Environmental Law and Policy

description: The common law of England and Wales is one of the major global legal traditions.
learning_outcomes: Understand the foundations of English Common Law. Grasp its historical context and its influence on global legal systems. Develop a basic understanding of legal traditions and terminology.
prerequisites: None
price: Free
title: Introduction to English Common Law

description: Delve into the research behind terrorism as you unpack the assumptions and impacts of both terrorism and counterterrorism.
learning_outcomes: Understand the theoretical foundations of terrorism and counterterrorism. Analyze the assumptions and impacts of different strategies. Compare and contrast various approaches to combating terrorism, informed by research and real-world examples.
prerequisites: None. A basic understanding of current events and an interest in the subject matter is recommended.
price: Free
title: Terrorism and Counterterrorism: Comparing Theory and Practice

description: Reducing Gun Violence in America: Evidence for Change is designed to provide learners with the best available science and insights from top scholars across the country as well as the skills to understand which interventions are the most effective to offer a path forward for reducing gun violence in our homes, schools, and communities.
learning_outcomes: Upon completion, learners will understand effective interventions for reducing gun violence. They will gain insights from top scholars and acquire skills to apply evidence-based strategies in their communities.
prerequisites: No prior knowledge is required. Basic understanding of public health concepts is helpful but not mandatory.
price: Free
title: Reducing Gun Violence in America: Evidence for Change

description: Drawing on the contributions of several academic disciplines including law, psychology, sociology, history, educational and health sciences, economy and anthropology, an interdisciplinary approach guides the student into a selection of critical issues concerning children’s rights. Participants will gain insight relative to the development of this specific human rights category, as well as to the evolution of the challenges faced by children over time and society’s efforts to respond. Successful international strategies and programs promoting children’s rights will be highlighted, as well as the role of key actors involved in international organizations working in this field. This open online course provides an overview of the most important features of children’s human rights. A central portion of the MOOC will consist of a presentation of the international and regional standards on children’s rights and the related international and regional judicial and quasi-judicial bodies designed to ensure their implementation.
learning_outcomes: Students will gain insight into the development of children's rights, challenges faced, and international strategies. They will understand international standards and the role of judicial bodies ensuring their implementation.
prerequisites: None. Open to anyone interested in children's rights.
price: Free
title: Children's Human Rights - An Interdisciplinary Introduction

description: Dyslexia is everywhere, touching so many children and adults, and while science has made extraordinary progress in understanding and clarifying the condition, this incredible powerful knowledge rarely reaches those who most need to know and would greatly benefit from it. Our goal is to change all this with the Coursera you are about to view, produced by Dr. Sally Shaywitz, the Audrey G. Ratner Professor in Learning Development, both the leading scientist studying dyslexia and the most devoted advocate for helping those who are dyslexic.
learning_outcomes: Understand dyslexia and its impact. Learn about the scientific progress in understanding the condition. Discover effective strategies for helping dyslexic individuals. Gain insights from Dr. Sally Shaywitz, a leading expert in the field.
prerequisites: None. Suitable for anyone interested in learning about dyslexia, regardless of prior knowledge.
price: Free
title: Overcoming Dyslexia

description: Vast amounts of personal information are processed in the cloud. But who is legally responsible for such ‘personal data’ in cloud environments? What duties do cloud providers like Amazon, Microsoft, and Google have? And what rights can you, as an individual, exercise under data protection law? If you’d like to find out, then this course is for you!
learning_outcomes: Understand legal responsibilities for personal data in the cloud. Learn about duties of cloud providers like Amazon, Microsoft, and Google.  Identify individual rights under data protection law.
prerequisites: None. Basic understanding of computing concepts is helpful but not required.
price: Free to Audit, Paid Certificate Available
title: Cloud Computing Law: Data Protection and Cybersecurity

description: In this course taught by E. Michael Harrington, students will learn the basis for copyright including what is and is not covered by copyright law. This course will help clarify what rights artists have as creators as well as what the public is free to take from their work. Students will also learn what to do if someone copies their work and what to do if they are accused of copying someone else. Finally, the course will discuss how technology has changed copyright for the better (and worse) and how copyright laws may change in the coming years.
learning_outcomes: Students will understand the fundamentals of copyright law, including what it protects and doesn't. They will learn how to protect their own work and what to do in case of infringement or accusations. The course also explores the impact of technology on copyright.
prerequisites: None. Basic understanding of music industry concepts is helpful but not required.
price: Free
skills: Leverage the copyright law to your advantage
title: Copyright Law in the Music Business

description: In our modern technologically-based economy, the creation and enforcement of patent rights can make or break a business. With record numbers of patents being issued every year, the stakes for inventors (and, indeed, their lawyers) continue to rise, even as the patent law and its administration faces growing criticism.
learning_outcomes: Understand the fundamentals of patent law, the process of patent creation, and the enforcement of patent rights. Learn about the challenges and criticisms within the patent system. Grasp the impact of patents on businesses.
prerequisites: None. Basic understanding of business principles is helpful.
price: Free to Audit, Paid Certificate Available
title: Patent Law

description: The European Union is one of the world’s largest and most important economies. This six week course is the first in a series of three that will provide students with an insight into European Business Law. The series ranges from considering the basic structures and principles of the European Union to focusing on various specialized areas of law. Each course will give the students an understanding of the laws and policies that regulate the internal market of European Union, as well as relevant case law and useful inputs from leading practitioners in the field.
learning_outcomes: Understand the fundamentals of European Business Law, the laws and policies regulating the EU internal market, and relevant case law. Gain insights from leading practitioners.
prerequisites: None. Basic understanding of business principles is helpful but not required.
price: Free
title: European Business Law: Understanding the Fundamentals

description: Have you ever wondered what’s in the small print of cloud contracts? Or who owns the information you upload to the cloud? And who can access and control it? If so, then this course is for you! You’ll learn to identify the legal risks involved in cloud computing transactions - and to suggest possible solutions.
learning_outcomes: Identify legal risks in cloud computing transactions. Understand ownership, access, and control of data in the cloud. Suggest solutions to mitigate risks associated with cloud contracts.
prerequisites: No prior legal or technical knowledge is required.
price: Free
title: Cloud Computing Law: Transactions

description: Copyright law is unique in the greater intellectual property regime, as it protects original expression that is fixed in a tangible medium and is the product of authorship.  This course is designed for creative professionals — such as screenwriters, musicians, documentary filmmakers or artists — who want to understand the scope and limits of which works can enjoy U.S. copyright protection. The course will introduce students to the workings of copyright law through an examination of the system’s basic principles, rules, and institutions. Topics will include; the justifications for copyright law, copyrightable subject matter, authorship, the nature and scope of copyright’s exclusive rights, fair use, and remedies for infringement.
learning_outcomes: Understand the principles, rules, and institutions of U.S. copyright law. Learn about copyrightable subject matter, authorship, exclusive rights, fair use, and remedies for infringement. Designed for creative professionals.
prerequisites: None. Basic understanding of legal concepts is helpful but not required.
price: Free to Audit. Paid certificate available.
title: Copyright Law

description: This course, Public Health in Humanitarian Crises 1, introduces discussions about the public health approach to problems experienced by people affected by disasters, both natural and related to conflict. The course discusses the many changes which occur in people’s lives when they are uprooted by a disaster, ranging from changes in disease patterns, access to health care, livelihoods, shelter, sanitary conditions, nutritional status, etceteras. We will explore what humanitarian interventions could look like if we want to mitigate the effects of disasters. The course content is a mix of theoretical knowledge and many practical examples from recent disasters. We think this course is unique because it contains so many practical ‘real-life’ examples and is taught by instructors and guest lecturers who together have over 200 years of experience in this field.
learning_outcomes: Upon completion, students will understand the public health approach to humanitarian crises, recognizing the impacts of disasters. They will also be able to identify potential interventions to mitigate the effects.
prerequisites: None. Basic understanding of public health concepts is helpful but not required.
price: Free
title: Public Health in Humanitarian Crises 1

description: In this course taught by E. Michael Harrington, students will learn the basis for copyright including what is and is not covered by copyright law. This course will help clarify what rights artists have as creators as well as what the public is free to take from their work. Students will also learn what to do if someone copies their work and what to do if they are accused of copying someone else. Finally, the course will discuss how technology has changed copyright for the better (and worse) and how copyright laws may change in the coming years.
learning_outcomes: Students will understand copyright basics, artist rights, and public usage rights. They will learn how to handle copyright infringement and the impact of technology on copyright law and future changes.
prerequisites: None. Basic understanding of the music business is helpful but not required.
price: Free (with option to pay for certificate)
skills: Leverage the copyright law to your advantage
title: Copyright Law in the Music Business

description: Have you ever wondered how a police officer in Europe can obtain evidence from a cloud provider in the USA? Or whether a major cloud provider might abuse its market power? Or in which countries cloud providers pay taxes? If so, then this course is for you!
learning_outcomes: Upon completing this course, you will understand the legal challenges of cloud computing, including law enforcement access to data, competition concerns, and tax implications for cloud providers in various jurisdictions.
prerequisites: No prior legal or technical knowledge is required. A general interest in cloud computing and its legal aspects is beneficial.
price: Free to Audit. Paid option available for Certificate.
title: Cloud Computing Law: Law Enforcement, Competition, & Tax

description: Intellectual property is the currency of the tech world, with the world’s most valuable intellectual property assets dwarfing the value of their real-world counterparts. Apple’ trademarked brand was valued at over $100 billion as of 2017. J.K. Rowling’s Harry potter franchise has generated over $25 billion to date. But how did the law come to create such enormous value in intangible assets?
learning_outcomes: Understand the creation of value in intangible assets like trademarks and franchises. Learn how the law shapes intellectual property. Grasp the fundamentals of brand and asset management within the context of intellectual property.
prerequisites: None. Basic understanding of legal concepts is helpful but not required.
price: Free to Audit. Paid certificate available.
title: Introduction to Intellectual Property

description: The protections afforded under trademark law have created incredible value in intangible assets, with the value of the world’s most valuable brands such as Amazon, Apple and Google each exceeding $100 billion. But what exactly is trademark law, and how is such enormous value created?
learning_outcomes: Understand trademark law and its role in protecting brand value. Learn how trademarks create value for businesses like Amazon, Apple, and Google. Grasp the fundamentals of brand management and strategic planning.
prerequisites: None. Basic understanding of business concepts is helpful but not required.
price: Free to Audit, Paid Certificate Available
title: Trademark Law

description: The European Union is one of the world's largest and most important economies. This specialization is a 3-course bundle that will teach learners the fundamentals of European Business Law.
learning_outcomes: Upon completion, learners will understand the fundamentals of European Business Law. They'll gain knowledge in areas like regulation, compliance, and international business within the EU.
prerequisites: No prior legal or business knowledge is required. Basic understanding of English is recommended.
price: Free to Audit. Paid Certificate Available.
title: European Business Law Specialization
